org.apache.juddi.adminconsole

Class AES

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juddi.adminconsole.AES

  • public class AES
extends Object
    This program uses a AES key, retrieves its raw bytes, and then reinstantiates a AES key from the key bytes. The reinstantiated key is used to initialize a AES cipher for encryption and decryption. source : http://java.sun.com/developer/technicalArticles/Security/AES/AES_v1.html
    Author:
    Alex O'Ree

    • Method Detail

      • GEN

        public static String GEN(int keysize)
        generates an AES based off of the selected key size
        Parameters:
        keysize -
        Returns:
        may return null if the key is not of a supported size by the current jdk

      • GEN

        public static String GEN()
        Generate a new AES 256 bit encryption key. Once generated, this key can be used to replace the default key.
        Returns:
        a base64 encoded key, 256 bit

      • ValidateKey

        public static boolean ValidateKey(String key)
        return true is the supplied key is a valid aes key
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        true if the key is valid

      • Encrypt

        public static String Encrypt(String clear,
                             String key)
                      throws Exception
        encrypts a password using AES Requires the Unlimited Strength Crypto Extensions
        Parameters:
        clear -
        key -
        Returns:
        a base64 encoded cipher of the clear text using the key
        Throws:
        Exception

      • Decrypt

        public static String Decrypt(String cipher,
                             String key)
        Decrypts a password or other sensitive data If the parameter is null or empty, an empty string is returned. If the parameter is not encrypted or was encrypted using a different key or it fails to decrypt, the original text is returned.
        Parameters:
        cipher - encrypted text
        key -
        Returns:
        the decrypted string
